name: places/ChIJra13dJVYwokRCaVFcvanKmA
adrFormatAddress: 1060 5th Ave #1A, New York, NY 10128, USA

originalText.text: I was just looking up Dr. Elliston’s address when the 1 star review came up and I feel an injustice has been done. I was at the office when the patient who was late came in. She was entitled, extremely rude, and not a few minutes late but 45+ minutes late- I know because she made an absolute scene about it and when the office asked her to reschedule, like an impertinent toddler she demanded to be seen. Ive been coming to this office for years, have a baby delivered by Dr. E, seen both Elizabeth and Dr. Ng.  Ive had a small wait but nothing unreasonable. And each provider has not only been sympathetic but set an example of working mothers.

originalText.text:
My favorite OB GYN ever! i had 2 pregrancies with them (1060obgyn), and all 3 doctors took really good care of me but Dr Elliston has this caring approach that is so reassuring. She is very gentle and professional. So happy that she was on call at the hospital for my second delivery, it went so well. Super encouraging and empathethic.
also i never felt rushed with her, even though she is obviously on a tight schedule.
5 stars

originalText.text:
My wife and I had the pleasure of having Dr Elliston for my wife’s version, which was successful.  She came across a wonderful/kind/caring professional and excellent OB, which we were both so thankful for.  The review could stop here and 5 stars would most certainly be warranted.

However, we were lucky enough to then get Dr Elliston for our induction, as Mum was overdue.  All was going smoothly until it wasn’t.

Not know to us, but our baby girl was being born with shoulder dystocia, and things went from 0 to 100 in seconds, 4 people in the delivery suite to 15.

This is the side of Dr Elliston you want in this serious medical situation(and hopefully you don’t get to see).

Laser like focus with her leadership of the room/team unparalleled. She was making split second life changing decisions for Mum and baby, whilst processing and reacting to the wealth of information presented to her, from both her peers, and the nurses. It was truly remarkable to witness.

Make no bones about it, Dr Elliston is an exceptional OB, operating at the very pinnacle of her craft.

She is also a wonderful human being, who popped in on us the next day,  just to check that we were all ok.

We would have no hesitation in highly recommending her(or 1060).

Mum and daughter are doing fantastic.

originalText.text: I was referred to Dr. Elliston by a friend. As first time expecting parents we were excited yet nervous. We waited over an hour our first visit which is understandable, however, the office staff never communicated any delays while we sat waiting only a few feet from them the entire hour. It wasn't until I got up and asked that they confirmed she was running behind. After meeting Dr. Elliston we felt she was compassionate and knowledgeable and decided to continue care with her. Our second visit and every visit after we again waited over an hour and the office staff failed to communicate any delays with us. I am a healthcare professional that manages a busy outpatient practice and I understand there are delays but a patient's quality of care is dependent upon proper communication. First, we update our patients every 15 minutes of any delays because we understand our patients are anxious and we want them to know we respect their time. Second, I would never allow my staff to sit around chatting and eating lunch in patient care areas. It's unfortunate that a qualified physician like Dr. Elliston has such a poorly managed and unprofessional office staff. It wasn't until my third visit that I noticed she was expecting and congratulated her. She assured me that she would be back in time to deliver our baby but she would have me meet her partner just in case; I never met her partner. We received a letter today from Dr. Elliston stating "she could no longer serve as our physician due to fact that she has a small practice and there are times she has to go and do emergency deliveries which may cause a delay in her schedule- that a bigger practice may be better suited for us". I am 6.5 months along and this was the most unprofessional handling I've ever seen. After months under her care and building trust, a phone call would have been appreciated and just the right thing to do. Pregnancy is stressful enough and then to have such a stressful experience with the person you trusted most to care for you and your baby is just horrible patient care. Im lucky I work in the healthcare industry and have the help to find a better physician but I sympathize with anyone else this has happened to that isn't so fortunate. Anyways, this is a blessing in disguise and will feel better under the care of a practice that is more professional.

originalText.text: I had been a patient of Dr. Elliston for many years, and had complained about suddenly heavy periods, missed periods, cramping 3/4 weeks, sometimes doubling up on periods and she always dismissed my concerns. I even asked for an ultrasound and she told me she didnt think it was necessary and stupidly I assumed because she was a doctor she would know best. Eventually I had enough of  being miserable and went to see someone for a second opinion and she immediately said she thought I had a fibroid. Sent me to get an ultrasound and turns out I had a fibroid so large it was the equivalent of me being 4 months pregnant. Unfortunately when they are this large you cant have a laparoscopic procedure and I ended up needing a myomectomy. This could have been avoided of I actually had a competent doctor who took my complaints serious.
